task.title: pwd
task.shortdesc: This command is used for knowing where you are on the file system.

prereq.p: You must have installed Linux or run it with through a virutal machine
You must have opened the terminal with the combination of Ctrl+Alt+T or from the menu â†’ terminal

context.p: The first command from this chapter is going to be one of the most important ones. It simply says:

Print Working Directory. As we know the directory is just a file, which is representing a content, or dynamic linking with flag which tells us that this file is a directory. We can move through the system when we are going to such a file. So pwd will basically print the current directory which we are in at the moment.
